BR_text.BRdescription: A common pattern for a Ray process is to connect to some socket(s). In these cases, we often try once and exit violently if the initial connection is unsuccessful. However, these failures to connect may be transient (for instance, if the listen buffer on the server-side is full during photon_connect). In these cases, we should retry the connection, with some backoff.

comments_0.comment_text:

 The test still passes even though one of the workers failed to connect. Also, when we run self.assertTrue(ray.services.all_processes_alive()), it doesn't catch the dead worker because workers are started from the local scheduler now (and not from services.py).
